entries.name: Spell Slots
entries: The Ranger Features table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your level 1+ spells. You regain all expended slots when you finish a {@rule Long Rest}.

entries.name: Prepared Spells of Level 1+
entries: You prepare the list of level 1+ spells that are available for you to cast with this feature. To start, choose two level 1 Ranger spells. {@spell Cure Wounds} and {@spell Ensnaring Strike} are recommended.

The number of spells on your list increases as you gain Ranger levels, as shown in the Spells column of the Ranger Features table. Whenever that number increases, choose additional Ranger spells until the number of spells on your list matches the number in the Ranger Features table. The chosen spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots. For example, if you're a level 5 Ranger, your list of prepared spells can include six Ranger spells of level 1 or 2 in any combination.

If another Ranger feature gives you spells that you always have prepared, those spells don't count against the number of spells you can prepare with this feature, but those spells otherwise count as Ranger spells for you.

entries.name: Changing Your Prepared Spells
entries: Whenever you finish a {@rule Long Rest}, you can replace one spell on your list with another Ranger spell for which you have spell slots.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for your Ranger spells.

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus
entries: You can use a {@item Druidic Focus} as a {@rule Spellcasting Focus} for your Ranger spells.

classFeature.name: Favored Enemy
entries: You always have the {@spell Hunter's Mark} spell prepared. You can cast it twice without expending a spell slot, and you regain all expended uses of this ability when you finish a {@rule Long Rest}.
The number of times you can cast the spell without a spell slot increases when you reach certain Ranger levels, as shown in the Favored {@rule Enemy} column of the Ranger Features table.

classFeature.name: Weapon Mastery
entries: Your training with weapons allows you to use the mastery properties of two kinds of weapons of your choice with which you have proficiency, such as {@item Longbow|Longbows} and {@item Shortsword|Shortswords}.

Whenever you finish a {@rule Long Rest}, you can change the kinds of weapons you chose. For example, you could switch to using the mastery properties of {@item Scimitar|Scimitars} and {@item Longsword|Longswords}.

classFeature.name: Deft Explorer
entries: Thanks to your travels, you gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Expertise
entries: Choose one of your skill proficiencies with which you lack {@rule Expertise}. You gain {@rule Expertise} in that skill.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You know two languages of your choice.

classFeature.name: Fighting Style
entries: You gain a {@other-features archery?feature-type-filter=Fighting|Fighting Style} option of your choice.

classFeature.name: Ranger Subclass
entries: You gain a Ranger subclass of your choice. A subclass is a specialization that grants you features at certain Ranger levels. For the rest of your career, you gain each of your subclass's features that are of your Ranger level or lower.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement} feat or another {@feat feat} of your choice for which you qualify. You gain this feature again at Ranger levels 8, 12, and 16.

classFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: You can attack twice instead of once whenever you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn.

classFeature.name: Roving
entries: Your {@rule Speed} increases by 10 feet while you aren't wearing Heavy armor. You also have a {@rule Climb Speed} and a {@rule Swim Speed} equal to your {@rule Speed}.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Ranger Subclass.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement} feat or another {@feat feat} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Expertise
entries: Choose two of your skill proficiencies with which you lack {@rule Expertise}. You gain {@rule Expertise} in those skills.

classFeature.name: Tireless
entries: Primal forces now help fuel you on your journeys, granting you the following benefits.

entries.name: Temporary Hit Points
entries: As a {@action Magic} action, you can give yourself a number of {@rule Temporary Hit Points} equal to 1d8 plus your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1). You can use this action a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@rule Long Rest}.

entries.name: Decrease Exhaustion
entries: Whenever you finish a {@rule Short Rest}, your {@condition Exhaustion} level, if any, decreases by 1.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Ranger Subclass.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement} feat or another {@feat feat} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Relentless Hunter
entries: Taking damage can't break your {@status Concentration} on Hunter's Mark.

classFeature.name: Nature's Veil
entries: You invoke spirits of nature to magically hide yourself. As a {@rule Bonus Action}, you can give yourself the {@condition Invisible} condition until the end of your next turn.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@rule Long Rest}.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Ranger Subclass.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement} feat or another {@feat feat} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Precise Hunter
entries: You have {@rule Advantage} on attack rolls against the creature currently marked by your Hunter's Mark.

classFeature.name: Feral Senses
entries: Your connection to the forces of nature grants you {@sense Blindsight} with a range of 30 feet.

classFeature.name: Epic Boon
entries: You gain an {@epic-boon Epic Boon} or another {@feat feat} of your choice for which you qualify. {@epic-boon Boon of Dimensional Travel} is recommended.

classFeature.name: Foe Slayer
entries: The damage die of your Hunter's Mark is a d10 rather than a d6.

subclassFeature.name: Beast Master
entries: {@i Bond with a Primal Beast}
A Beast Master forms a mystical bond with a special animal, drawing on primal magic and a deep connection to the natural world.

subclassFeature.name: Primal Companion
entries: You magically summon a primal beast, which draws strength from your bond with nature. Choose its stat block: {@creature Beast of the Land}, {@creature Beast of the Sea}, or {@creature Beast of the Sky}. You also determine the kind of animal it is, choosing a kind appropriate for the stat block. Whatever beast you choose, it bears primal markings indicating its supernatural origin.
The beast is Friendly to you and your allies and obeys your commands. It vanishes if you die.

entries.name: The Beast in Combat
entries: In combat, the beast acts during your turn. It can move and use its {@rule Reaction} on its own, but the only action it takes is the {@action Dodge} action unless you take a {@rule Bonus Action} to command it to take an action in its stat block or some other action. You can also sacrifice one of your attacks when you take the {@action Attack} action to command the beast to take the Beast's Strike action. If you have the {@condition Incapacitated} condition, the beast acts on its own and isn't limited to the {@action Dodge} action.

entries.name: Restoring or Replacing the Beast
entries: If the beast has died within the last hour, you can take a {@action Magic} action to touch it and expend a spell slot. The beast returns to life after 1 minute with all its Hit Points restored.

Whenever you finish a {@rule Long Rest}, you can summon a different primal beast, which appears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of you. You choose its stat block and appearance. If you already have a beast from this feature, the old one vanishes when the new one appears.

subclassFeature.name: Exceptional Training
entries: When you take a {@rule Bonus Action} to command your Primal Companion beast to take an action, you can also command it to take the {@action Dash}, {@action Disengage}, {@action Dodge}, or {@action Help} action using its {@rule Bonus Action}.
In addition, whenever it hits with an attack roll and deals damage, it can deal your choice of Force damage or its normal damage type.

subclassFeature.name: Bestial Fury
entries: When you command your Primal Companion beast to take the Beast's Strike action, the beast can use it twice.
In addition, the first time each turn it hits a creature under the effect of your {@spell Hunter's Mark} spell, the beast deals extra Force damage equal to the bonus damage of that spell.

subclassFeature.name: Share Spells
entries: When you cast a spell targeting yourself, you can also affect your Primal Companion beast with the spell if the beast is within 30 feet of you.

subclassFeature.name: Fey Wanderer
entries: {@i Wield Fey Mirth and Fury}

A fey mystique surrounds you, thanks to the boon of an archfey or a location in the Feywild that transformed you. However you gained fey magic, you are now a Fey Wanderer. Your joyful laughter brightens the hearts of the downtrodden, and your martial prowess strikes terror in your foes, for great is the mirth of the fey and dreadful is their fury.

subclassFeature.name: Dreadful Strikes
entries: You can augment your weapon strikes with mind-scarring magic drawn from the murky hollows of the Feywild. When you hit a creature with a weapon, you can deal an extra {@damage 1d6} Psychic damage to the target, which can take this extra damage only once per turn. The extra damage increases to 1d10 when you reach Ranger level 11.

subclassFeature.name: Fey Wanderer Spells
entries: When you reach a Ranger level specified in the Fey Wanderer Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.
You also possess a fey blessing. Choose it from the Feywild Gifts table or determine it randomly.

entries.caption: Feywild Gifts
rows: Illusory butterflies flutter around you while you take a Short or Long Rest.
Flowers bloom from your hair each dawn.
You faintly smell of cinnamon, lavender, nutmeg, or another comforting herb or spice.
Your shadow dances while no one is looking directly at it.
Horns or antlers sprout from your head.
Your skin and hair change color each dawn.

subclassFeature.name: Otherworldly Glamour
entries: Whenever you make a Charisma check, you gain a bonus to the check equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of +1).
You also gain proficiency in one of these skills of your choice: {@skill Deception}, {@skill Performance}, or {@skill Persuasion}.

subclassFeature.name: Beguiling Twist
entries: The magic of the Feywild guards your mind. You have {@rule Advantage} on saving throws to avoid or end the {@condition Charmed} or {@condition Frightened} condition.

In addition, whenever you or a creature you can see within 120 feet of you succeeds on a saving throw to avoid or end the {@condition Charmed} or {@condition Frightened} condition, you can take a {@rule Reaction} to force a different creature you can see within 120 feet of yourself to make a Wisdom save against your spell save DC. On a failed save, the target is {@condition Charmed} or {@condition Frightened} (your choice) for 1 minute. The target repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

subclassFeature.name: Fey Reinforcements
entries: You can cast {@spell Summon Fey} without a Material component. You can also cast it once without a spell slot, and you regain the ability to cast it in this way when you finish a {@rule Long Rest}.
Whenever you start casting the spell, you can modify it so that it doesn't require {@status Concentration}. If you do so, the spell's duration becomes 1 minute for that casting.

subclassFeature.name: Misty Wanderer
entries: You can cast {@spell Misty Step} without expending a spell slot. You can do so a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@rule Long Rest}.

In addition, whenever you cast {@spell Misty Step}, you can bring along one willing creature you can see within 5 feet of yourself. That creature teleports to an unoccupied space of your choice within 5 feet of your destination space.

subclassFeature.name: Gloom Stalker
entries: {@i Draw on Shadow Magic to Fight Your Foes}
Gloom Stalkers are at home in the darkest places, wielding magic drawn from the Shadowfell to combat enemies that lurk in darkness.

subclassFeature.name: Gloom Stalker Spells
entries: When you reach a Ranger level specified in the Gloom Stalker Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

subclassFeature.name: Dread Ambusher
entries: You have mastered the art of creating fearsome ambushes, granting you the following benefits.

entries.name: Ambusher's Leap
entries: At the start of your first turn of each combat, your {@rule Speed} increases by 10 feet until the end of that turn.

entries.name: Frighten
entries: When you attack a creature and hit it with a weapon, you can deal an extra {@damage 2d6} Psychic damage. You can use this benefit only once per turn, you can use it a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@rule Long Rest}.

entries.name: Initiative Bonus
entries: When you roll {@rule Initiative}, you can add your Wisdom modifier to the roll.

subclassFeature.name: Umbral Sight
entries: You gain {@sense Darkvision} with a range of 60 feet. If you already have {@sense Darkvision} when you gain this feature, its range increases by 60 feet.

You are also adept at evading creatures that rely on {@sense Darkvision}. While entirely in {@rule Darkness}, you have the {@condition Invisible} condition to any creature that relies on {@sense Darkvision} to see you in that {@rule Darkness}. Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

subclassFeature.name: Iron Mind
entries: You have honed your ability to resist mind-altering powers. You gain proficiency in Wisdom saving throws. If you already have this proficiency, you instead gain proficiency in Intelligence or Charisma saving throws (your choice).

subclassFeature.name: Stalker's Flurry
entries: The Psychic damage of your Dreadful Strike becomes 2d8. In addition, when you use the Dreadful Strike effect of your Dread Ambusher feature, you can cause one of the following additional effects.

entries.name: Sudden Strike
entries: You can make another attack with the same weapon against a different creature that is within 5 feet of the original target and that is within the weapon's range.

entries.name: Mass Fear
entries: The target and each creature within 10 feet of it must make a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, a creature has the {@condition Frightened} condition until the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Shadowy Dodge
entries: When a creature makes an attack roll against you, you can take a {@rule Reaction} to impose {@rule Disadvantage} on that roll. Whether the attack hits or misses, you can then teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see.

subclassFeature.name: Hunter
entries: {@i Protect Nature and People from Destruction}
You stalk prey in the wilds and elsewhere, using your abilities as a Hunter to protect nature and people everywhere from forces that would destroy them.

subclassFeature.name: Hunter's Lore
entries: You can call on the forces of nature to reveal certain strengths and weaknesses of your prey. While a creature is marked by your Hunter's Mark, you know whether that creature has any Immunities, Resistances, or Vulnerabilities, and if the creature has any, you know what they are.

subclassFeature.name: Hunter's Prey
entries: You gain one of the following feature options of your choice. Whenever you finish a Short or Long Rest, you can replace the chosen option with the other one.

entries.name: Colossus Slayer
entries: Your tenacity can wear down even the most resilient foes. When you hit a creature with a weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 1d8} damage to the target if it's missing any of its Hit Points. You can deal this extra damage only once per turn.

entries.name: Horde Breaker
entries: Once on each of your turns when you make an attack with a weapon, you can make another attack with the same weapon against a different creature that is within 5 feet of the original target, that is within the weapon's range, and that you haven't attacked this turn.

subclassFeature.name: Defensive Tactics
entries: You gain one of the following feature options of your choice. Whenever you finish a Short or Long Rest, you can replace the chosen option with the other one.

entries.name: Escape the Horde
entries: {@action Opportunity Attacks} have {@rule Disadvantage} against you.

entries.name: Multiattack Defense
entries: When a creature hits you with an attack roll, that creature has {@rule Disadvantage} on all other attack rolls against you this turn.

subclassFeature.name: Superior Hunter's Prey
entries: Once per turn when you deal damage to a creature marked by your Hunter's Mark, you can also deal that spell's extra damage to a different creature that you can see within 30 feet of the first creature.

subclassFeature.name: Superior Hunter's Defense
entries: When you take damage, you can take a {@rule Reaction} to give yourself {@rule Resistance} to that damage and any other damage of the same type until the end of the current turn.

fluff.name: Rogue
entries: Stealthy killers who are defined by their ability to hit enemies where it will cause the most damage. Rogues used honed skill and quick hands to approach, kill, and retreat before the target can respond.

weapons: Martial weapons that have the Finesse or Light property

entries: {@i Choose A or B:} (A) {@item Leather Armor}, 2 {@item Dagger|Daggers}, {@item Shortsword}, {@item Shortbow}, {@item Arrows (20)|20 Arrows}, {@item Quiver}, {@item Thieves' Tools}, {@item Burglar's Pack}, and 8 GP; or (B) 100 GP

classFeature.name: Sneak Attack
entries: You know how to strike subtly and exploit a foe's distraction. Once per turn, you can deal an extra {@damage 1d6} damage to one creature you hit with an attack roll if you have {@rule Advantage} on the roll and the attack uses a Finesse or a Ranged weapon. The extra damage's type is the same as the weapon's type.

You don't need {@rule Advantage} on the attack roll if at least one of your allies is within 5 feet of the target, the ally doesn't have the {@condition Incapacitated} condition, and you don't have {@rule Disadvantage} on the attack roll.
The extra damage increases as you gain Rogue levels, as shown in the Sneak Attack column of the Rogue Features table.

classFeature.name: Expertise
entries: You gain {@rule Expertise} in two of your skill proficiencies of your choice. {@skill Sleight of Hand} and {@skill Stealth} are recommended if you have proficiency in them.
At Rogue level 6, you gain {@rule Expertise} in two more of your skill proficiencies of your choice.

classFeature.name: Thieves' Cant
entries: You picked up various languages in the communities where you plied your roguish talents. You know Thieves' Cant and one other language of your choice.

classFeature.name: Weapon Mastery
entries: Your training with weapons allows you to use the mastery properties of two kinds of weapons of your choice with which you have proficiency, such as {@item Dagger|Daggers} and {@item Shortbow|Shortbows}.

Whenever you finish a {@rule Long Rest}, you can change the kinds of weapons you chose. For example, you could switch to using the mastery properties of {@item Scimitar|Scimitars} and {@item Shortsword|Shortswords}.

classFeature.name: Cunning Action
entries: Your quick thinking and agility allow you to move and act quickly. On your turn, you can take one of the following actions as a {@rule Bonus Action}: {@action Dash}, {@action Disengage}, or {@action Hide}.

classFeature.name: Rogue Subclass
entries: You gain a Rogue subclass of your choice. A subclass is a specialization that grants you features at certain Rogue levels. For the rest of your career, you gain each of your subclass's features that are of your Rogue level or lower.

classFeature.name: Steady Aim
entries: As a {@rule Bonus Action}, you give yourself {@rule Advantage} on your next attack roll on the current turn. You can use this feature only if you haven't moved during this turn, and after you use it, your {@rule Speed} is 0 until the end of the current turn.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement} feat or another {@feat feat} of your choice for which you qualify. You gain this feature again at Rogue levels 8, 10, 12, and 16.

classFeature.name: Cunning Strike
entries: You've developed cunning ways to use your Sneak Attack. When you deal Sneak Attack damage, you can add one of the following Cunning Strike effects. Each effect has a die cost, which is the number of Sneak Attack damage dice you must forgo to add the effect. You remove the die before rolling, and the effect occurs immediately after the attack's damage is dealt. For example, if you add the Poison effect, remove 1d6 from the Sneak Attack's damage before rolling.
If a Cunning Strike effect requires a saving throw, the DC equals 8 plus your Dexterity modifier and {@rule Proficiency} Bonus.

classFeature.name: Poison
entries: You add a toxin to your strike, forcing the target to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target has the {@condition Poisoned} condition for 1 minute. At the end of each of its turns, the {@condition Poisoned} target repeats the save, ending the effect on itself on a success.
To use this effect, you must have a {@item Poisoner's Kit} on your person.

classFeature.name: Trip
entries: If the target is Large or smaller, it must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or have the {@condition Prone} condition.

classFeature.name: Withdraw
entries: Immediately after the attack, you move up to half your {@rule Speed} without provoking {@action Opportunity Attack|Opportunity Attacks}.

classFeature.name: Uncanny Dodge
entries: When an attacker that you can see hits you with an attack roll, you can take a {@rule Reaction} to halve the attack's damage against you (round down).

classFeature.name: Expertise
entries: You gain {@rule Expertise} in two of your Skill Proficiencies of your choice.

classFeature.name: Evasion
entries: You can nimbly dodge out of the way of certain dangers. When you're subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw and only half damage if you fail. You can't use this feature if you have the {@condition Incapacitated} condition.

classFeature.name: Reliable Talent
entries: Whenever you make an ability check that uses one of your skill or tool proficiencies, you can treat a d20 roll of 9 or lower as a 10.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement} feat or another {@feat feat} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Rogue Subclass.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement} feat or another {@feat feat} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Improved Cunning Strike
entries: You can use up to two Cunning Strike effects when you deal Sneak Attack damage, paying the die cost for each effect.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement} feat or another {@feat feat} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Rogue Subclass.

classFeature.name: Devious Strikes
entries: You've practiced new ways to use your Sneak Attack deviously. The following effects are now among your Cunning Strike options.

classFeature.name: Daze
entries: The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw, or on its next turn, it can do only one of the following: move or take an action or a {@rule Bonus Action}.

classFeature.name: Knock Out
entries: The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw, or it has the {@condition Unconscious} condition for 1 minute or until it takes any damage. The {@condition Unconscious} target repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

classFeature.name: Obscure
entries: The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw, or it has the {@condition Blinded} condition until the end of its next turn.

classFeature.name: Slippery Mind
entries: Your cunning mind is exceptionally difficult to control. You gain proficiency in Wisdom and Charisma saving throws.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement} feat or another {@feat feat} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Rogue Subclass.

classFeature.name: Elusive
entries: You're so evasive that attackers rarely gain the upper hand against you. No attack roll can have {@rule Advantage} against you unless you have the {@condition Incapacitated} condition.

classFeature.name: Epic Boon
entries: You gain an {@epic-boon Epic Boon} or another {@feat feat} of your choice for which you qualify. {@epic-boon Boon of the Night Spirit} is recommended.

classFeature.name: Stroke of Luck
entries: You have a marvelous knack for succeeding when you need to. If you fail a {@rule D20 Test}, you can turn the roll into a 20.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a Short or Long Rest.

subclassFeature.name: Assassin
entries: {@i Practice the Grim Art of Death}

An Assassin's training focuses on using stealth, poison, and disguise to eliminate foes with deadly efficiency. While some Rogues who follow this path are hired killers, spies, or bounty hunters, the capabilities of this subclass are equally useful for adventurers facing a variety of monstrous enemies.

subclassFeature.name: Assassin's Tools
entries: You gain a {@item Disguise Kit} and a {@item Poisoner's Kit}, and you have proficiency with them.

subclassFeature.name: Assassinate
entries: You're adept at ambushing a target, granting you the following benefits.

entries.name: Initiative
entries: You have {@rule Advantage} on {@rule Initiative} rolls.

entries.name: Deadly
entries: You use d8s when rolling damage for your Sneak Attack, instead of d6s.

entries.name: Surprising Strikes
entries: During the first round of each combat, you have {@rule Advantage} on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn. If your Sneak Attack hits any target during that round, the target takes extra damage of the weapon's type equal to your Rogue level.

subclassFeature.name: Infiltration Expertise
entries: You are expert at the following techniques that aid your infiltrations.

entries.name: Masterful Mimicry
entries: You can unerringly mimic another person's speech, handwriting, or both if you have spent at least 1 hour studying them.

entries.name: Roving Aim
entries: Your {@rule Speed} isn't reduced to 0 by using Steady Aim.

subclassFeature.name: Envenom Weapons
entries: When you use the Poison option of your Cunning Strike, the target also takes {@damage 2d6} Poison damage whenever it fails the saving throw. This damage ignores {@rule Resistance} to Poison damage.

subclassFeature.name: Death Strike
entries: When you hit with your Sneak Attack on the first round of a combat, the target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw (DC 8 plus your Dexterity modifier and {@rule Proficiency} Bonus), or the attack's damage is doubled against the target.

subclassFeature.name: Soulknife
entries: {@i Strike Foes with Psionic Blades}

A Soulknife strikes with the mind, cutting through barriers both physical and psychic. These Rogues discover psionic power within themselves and channel it to do their roguish work. As a Soulknife, your psionic abilities might have haunted you since childhood, revealing their full potential only as you experienced the stress of adventure. Or you might have sought out an order of psychic adepts and spent years learning how to manifest your power.

subclassFeature.name: Psionic Power
entries: You harbor a wellspring of psionic energy within yourself. It is represented by your Psionic Energy Dice, which fuel certain powers you have from this subclass. The Soulknife Energy Dice table shows the number of these dice you have when you reach certain Rogue levels, and the table shows the die size.

Any features in this subclass that use a Psionic Energy Die use only the dice from this subclass. Some of your powers expend a Psionic Energy Die, as specified in a power's description, and you can't use a power if it requires you to use a die when your Psionic Energy Dice are all expended.
You regain one of your expended Psionic Energy Dice when you finish a {@rule Short Rest}, and you regain all of them when you finish a {@rule Long Rest}.

entries.name: Psi-Bolstered Knack
entries: If you fail an ability check using a skill or tool with which you have proficiency, you can roll one Psionic Energy Die and add the number rolled to the check, potentially turning failure into success. The die is expended only if the roll then succeeds.

entries.name: Psychic Whispers
entries: You can establish telepathic communication between yourself and others. As a {@action Magic} action, choose one or more creatures you can see, up to a number of creatures equal to your {@rule Proficiency} Bonus, and then roll one Psionic Energy Die. For a number of hours equal to the number rolled, the chosen creatures can speak telepathically with you, and you can speak telepathically with them. To send or receive a message (no action required), you and the other creature must be within 1 mile of each other. A creature can end the telepathic connection at any time (no action required).
The first time you use this power after each {@rule Long Rest}, you don't expend the Psionic Energy Die. All other times you use the power, you expend the die.

subclassFeature.name: Psychic Blades
entries: You can manifest shimmering blades of psychic energy. Whenever you take the {@action Attack} action or make an {@action Opportunity Attack}, you can manifest a {@item Psychic Blade} in your free hand and make the attack with that blade. The magic blade has the following traits:
The blade vanishes immediately after it hits or misses its target, and it leaves no mark if it deals damage.

After you attack with the blade on your turn, you can make a melee or ranged attack with a second psychic blade as a {@rule Bonus Action} on the same turn if your other hand is free to create it. The damage die of this bonus attack is 1d4 instead of 1d6.

subclassFeature.name: Soul Blades
entries: You can now use the following powers with your Psychic Blades.

entries.name: Homing Strikes
entries: If you make an attack roll with your {@item Psychic Blade} and miss the target, you can roll one Psionic Energy Die and add the number rolled to the attack roll. If this causes the attack to hit, the die is expended.

entries.name: Psychic Teleportation
entries: As a {@rule Bonus Action}, you manifest a {@item Psychic Blade}, expend one Psionic Energy Die and roll it, and throw the blade at an unoccupied space you can see up to a number of feet away equal to 10 times the number rolled. You then teleport to that space, and the blade vanishes.

subclassFeature.name: Psychic Veil
entries: You can weave a veil of psychic static to mask yourself. As a {@action Magic} action, you gain the {@condition Invisible} condition for 1 hour or until you dismiss this effect (no action required). This invisibility ends early immediately after you deal damage to a creature or you force a creature to make a saving throw.
Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a {@rule Long Rest} unless you expend a Psionic Energy Die (no action required) to restore your use of it.

subclassFeature.name: Rend Mind
entries: You can sweep your Psychic Blades through a creature's mind. When you use your Psychic Blades to deal Sneak Attack damage to a creature, you can force that target to make a Wisdom saving throw (DC 8 plus your Dexterity modifier and {@rule Proficiency} Bonus). If the save fails, the target has the {@condition Stunned} condition for 1 minute. The {@condition Stunned} target repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a {@rule Long Rest} unless you expend three Psionic Energy Dice (no action required) to restore your use of it.

subclassFeature.name: Thief
entries: {@i Hunt for Treasure as a Classic Adventurer}

A mix of burglar, treasure hunter, and explorer, you are the epitome of an adventurer. In addition to improving your agility and stealth, you gain abilities useful for delving into ruins and getting maximum benefit from the magic items you find there.

subclassFeature.name: Fast Hands
entries: As a {@rule Bonus Action}, you can do one of the following.

entries.name: Sleight of Hand
entries: Make a Dexterity ({@skill Sleight of Hand}) check to pick a lock or disarm a trap with {@item Thieves' Tools} or to pick a pocket.

entries.name: Use an Object
entries: Take the {@action Utilize} action, or take the {@action Magic} action to use a magic item that requires that action.

subclassFeature.name: Second-Story Work
entries: You've trained to get into especially hard-to-reach places, granting you these benefits.

entries.name: Climber
entries: You gain a {@rule Climb Speed} equal to your {@rule Speed}.

entries.name: Jumper
entries: You can determine your jump distance using your Dexterity rather than your Strength.

subclassFeature.name: Supreme Sneak
entries: You gain the following Cunning Strike option.

entries.name: Stealth Attack (Cost: 1d6)
entries: If you have the {@action Hide} action's {@condition Invisible} condition, this attack doesn't end that condition on you if you end the turn behind {@rule Cover|Three-Quarters Cover} or {@rule Cover|Total Cover}.

subclassFeature.name: Use Magic Device
entries: You've learned how to maximize use of magic items, granting you the following benefits.

entries.name: Attunement
entries: You can attune to up to four magic items at once.

entries.name: Charges
entries: Whenever you use a magic item property that expends charges, roll 1d6. On a roll of 6, you use the property without expending the charges.

entries.name: Scrolls
entries: You can use any {@item Spell Scroll}, using Intelligence as your spellcasting ability for the spell. If the spell is a cantrip or a level 1 spell, you can cast it reliably. If the scroll contains a higher-level spell, you must first succeed on an Intelligence ({@skill Arcana}) check (DC 10 plus the spell's level). On a successful check, you cast the spell from the scroll. On a failed check, the scroll disintegrates.

subclassFeature.name: Thief's Reflexes
entries: You are adept at laying ambushes and quickly escaping danger. You can take two turns during the first round of any combat. You take your first turn at your normal {@rule Initiative} and your second turn at your {@rule Initiative} minus 10.

fluff.name: Commander
entries: These natural-born leaders stand as stalwart figures in the face of danger and can rally their allies to overcome whatever obstacles may stand between them and their goals.

tools: Choose one type of {@item gaming set}

default: (a) {@item scale mail} or (b) a {@item leather armor}
(a) any simple weapon or (b) {@item longsword} or (c) a {@item rapier}
(a) {@item light crossbow} and 20 {@item Crossbow Bolt} or (b) five {@item javelin|javelins}
(a) a {@item scholar's pack} or (b) an {@item explorer's pack}

classFeature.name: Leadership Style
entries: At 1st level, you choose a Leadership Style from the options below. Each choice grants certain benefits and determines the ability score you will use for your Leadership modifier:

entries.name: Captain
entries: You lead from the front with presence. You use Charisma as your Leadership modifier. You also gain proficiency in heavy armor and your choice of either Intimidation or Persuasion.

entries.name: Mentor
entries: You counsel others with wise insights. You use Wisdom as your Leadership modifier. Also, whenever a creature within 15 feet misses with an attack or fails an ability check you can use your reaction to roll a d4 and add the result to its roll.

entries.name: Strategist
entries: You guide others with cunning and wit. You use Intelligence as your Leadership modifier, and when you roll initiative you can switch places in initiative order with a willing creature.

classFeature.name: Inspiring Word
entries: Your words encourage others to fight on. At 1st level, you use a bonus action to shout an inspiring word at another creature that can hear you within 30 feet. It regains hit points equal to one roll of its Hit Die + your Leadership modifier. The target does not expend its Hit Dice as part of this ability.
You can use this feature the number of times indicated in the Inspiring Word column on the Commander table. You regain all expended uses when you finish a short or long rest.

classFeature.name: Fighting Style
entries: At 2nd level, you adopt a {@other-features archery?feature-type-filter=Fighting|Fighting Style} that best reflects your training.
Whenever you gain a level in this class, you can switch your Fighting Style for another Fighting Style of your choice.

classFeature.name: Tactical Exploits
entries: Your knowledge of war allows you to utilize potent strategies in battle. At 2nd level, you learn to employ {@other-features/EX attack-order?feature-type-filter=Tactical|Tactical Exploits}:

entries.name: Exploits Known
entries: You know two {@other-features/EX attack-order|Tactical Exploits} of your choice from the list. The Exploits Known column of the Commander table shows when you learn more Exploits. To learn an Exploit you must meet any prerequisites it may have, like a minimum Ability Score or Commander level. Finally, each time you gain a level in this class, you can replace one Exploit you know with another {@other-features/EX attack-order?feature-type-filter=Tactical|Tactical Exploits} of your choice.

entries.name: Saving Throws
entries: If one of your Tactical Exploits requires a creature to make a saving throw, the DC equals 8 plus your Leadership modifier and {@rule Proficiency} Bonus.

classFeature.name: Exploit Dice
entries: The Commander table shows how many Exploit Dice you have to perform the Exploits you know. Some Exploits require you to expend these Dice in order to use them. You can only use one Exploit per attack, ability check, or saving throw. You regain all of your Exploit Dice when you finish a short or long rest.
Your Exploit Dice begin as d4s and increase in size as you gain levels in this class, as indicated in the Commander table.

classFeature.name: Academy of War
entries: At 3rd level, choose the Academy of War that best represents your Commander: the Academy of Chivalry, Ferocity, Schemes, or Tactics.
Your Academy of War grants you features at 3rd level, and again when you reach 6th, 14th, and 18th levels in this class.

entries.name: Academy Exploits
entries: Each Academy of War has a list of Academy Exploits that all members of that Academy learn at the Commander levels in your Academy's description. Your Academy Exploits do not count against your total number of Exploits Known and they can't be switched out when you gain a level. If you don't meet a Signature Exploit's prerequisites, you learn it regardless.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement} feat or another {@feat feat} of your choice for which you qualify. You gain this feature again at Commander levels 8, 12, and 16.

classFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, when you take the Attack action on your turn.

classFeature.name: Academy Feature
entries: At 6th level, you gain a feature granted by your Academy of War.

classFeature.name: Valiant Leader
entries: You have honed your Leadership Style with practice and study. Starting at 7th level, your Leadership Style grants you further benefits:

entries.name: Captain
entries: You can target creatures that are at 0 hit points, but not dead, with an Inspiring Word, even though they can't hear you and normally would not benefit from this feature.

entries.name: Mentor
entries: When you use your Mentor reaction its range is 30 feet. Also, the bonus increases to match one roll of the die in the Exploit Die column for your level on the Commander table.

entries.name: Strategist
entries: You, and creatures of your choice within 15 feet of you gain a bonus to initiative rolls equal to your Intelligence modifier, so long as you are not surprised or incapacitated.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement} feat or another {@feat feat} of your choice for which you qualify. You gain this feature again at Commander levels 8, 12, and 16.

classFeature.name: Rallying Cry
entries: You can encourage allies to find success when they otherwise would fail. Beginning at 9th level, when another creature that can see or hear you within 30 feet fails a saving throw, you can use your reaction to encourage it with a rallying cry. The creature immediately re-rolls its saving throw and adds your Leadership modifier (minimum of +1) to its result.
Once you use this feature you must finish a short or long rest before you can use it again. You gain an additional use of this feature when you reach 13th and 17th level in this class.

classFeature.name: Unwavering Will
entries: As a leader, you do not have the luxury of succumbing to your base instincts. Beginning at 10th level, you have advantage on saving throws to resist being charmed, frightened, or stunned.

classFeature.name: Tactical Superiority
entries: Your leadership skills eclipse even those of other professional leaders. Starting at 11th level, when you roll in initiative you regain one use of both Inspiring Word and Rallying Cry.
Also, the range of your Inspiring Word, Rallying Cry, and any Tactical Exploits that you know are doubled.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement} feat or another {@feat feat} of your choice for which you qualify. You gain this feature again at Commander levels 8, 12, and 16.

classFeature.name: Academy Feature
entries: At 14th level, you gain a feature granted by your Academy of War.

classFeature.name: Exalted Leader
entries: You are a true master of your Leadership Style. At 15th level, your Leadership Style grants you the benefits listed below:

entries.name: Captain
entries: Whenever you target a creature with Inspiring Word, Rallying Cry, or a Tactical Exploit, you can grant one target temporary hit points equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of +1)

entries.name: Mentor
entries: When you use Inspiring Word on a creature you end one of the following conditions currently affecting it (your choice): blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, poisoned, or stunned.

entries.name: Strategist
entries: When you use Inspiring Word on a creature it can move up to its Speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement} feat or another {@feat feat} of your choice for which you qualify. You gain this feature again at Commander levels 8, 12, and 16.

classFeature.name: Academy Feature
entries: At 18th level, you gain a feature granted by your Academy of War.

classFeature.name: Dauntless
entries: You rival the great commanders and conquerors of legend. At 20th level, you can use Rallying Cry an unlimited number of times. Moreover, whenever you use Inspiring Word you treat the hit points it restores as the maximum possible result.

subclassFeature.name: Academy of Chivalry
entries: Commanders that select the Academy of Chivalry often hail from the ranks of the nobility and are most always formal knights. As leaders, they hold themselves and those who follow them to a lofty code of conduct. These knights stand as beacons of fair play, honor, and justice, both on and off the field of battle.

subclassFeature.name: Chivalric Exploits
entries: You learn certain Exploits at the Commander levels noted in the table below. They don't count against your total number of Exploits Known and can't be switched upon gaining a level.

subclassFeature.name: Anointed Knight
entries: You have been trained in the classical skills of knighthood. You gain proficiency with all martial weapons, one musical instrument, and in either History, Performance, or Religion.

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Presence
entries: Your presence on the field of battle inspires those who fight beside you. When you roll initiative you can expend one use of Inspiring Word to grant a number of creatures equal to your Leadership modifier (minimum of 1) that can see or hear you within 30 feet temporary hit points equal to a roll of your Exploit Die + your Leadership modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Lead the Charge
entries: You lead best from the front lines. When you take the Attack action on your turn and make at least one melee attack, you can issue an {@other-features/EX attack order} as a bonus action on that turn.

subclassFeature.name: Flames of Hope
entries: As an action, you can let forth a cry that inflames the hearts of allies and inspires terror in your foes. Creatures that can hear you within 30 feet gain one of the following effects:

items: Friendly creatures gain temporary hit points equal to a roll of your Exploit Die + your Leadership modifier, and while these last the creature cannot be frightened.

Enemy creatures must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your Exploit Save DC or be frightened of you for 1 minute. Frightened creatures can repeat this saving throw at the end of each of their turns and each time they take damage, ending the effect on a success.

entries: Once you use this feature you must complete a short or long rest before you can use it again.

subclassFeature.name: Paragon of Chivalry
entries: You stand as an exemplar of chivalric virtue, a shining beacon for those who follow you. You are immune to the frightened and charmed conditions, and creatures of your choice within 30 feet that can see you have advantage on saving throws to resist and end the charmed and frightened conditions.

subclassFeature.name: Academy of Ferocity
entries: Commanders who hail from this Academy rarely study at formal schools of war. In place of using military theory, their tactics are based on the instincts of wild predators. These leaders are famous for their ruthless treatment of their foes, though they would lay down their life for any member of their pack.

subclassFeature.name: Ferocious Exploits
entries: You learn certain Exploits at the Commander levels noted in the table below. They don't count against your total number of Exploits Known and can't be switched upon gaining a level.

subclassFeature.name: Bestial Instincts
entries: You learn to track and hunt as well as the great predators of the wilds. You gain proficiency with martial weapons and in your choice of either Perception or Survival.
In addition, whenever you make a Wisdom (Survival) or a Wisdom (Perception) check based on your sense of smell or hearing, you can treat a roll of 7 or lower on the d20 as an 8.

subclassFeature.name: Packleader
entries: You lead your allies in the hunt. As a bonus action, you can mark one creature you can see within 30 feet as your Prey. Any creature you target with an Inspiring Word or a Tactical Exploit has advantage on the first attack it makes against your Prey before the beginning of your next turn.

The mark ends early if your Prey is reduced to 0 hit points, if you mark another creature, or if you are incapacitated.ies in the hunt. As a bonus action, you can mark one creature you can see within 30 feet as your Prey. Any creature you target with an Inspiring Word or a Tactical Exploit has advantage on the first attack it makes against your Prey before the beginning of your next turn.
Once you mark a creature as Prey, you must finish a short or long rest before you can mark another. If you have no uses left, you can expend an Exploit Die to mark another creature.

subclassFeature.name: Primal Ambush
entries: Under your leadership, your pack moves and hunts as one. You and creatures of your choice within 30 feet of your have advantage on your Dexterity (Stealth) checks and can travel stealthily while moving at a normal pace.
Also, while you have a creature marked as your Prey, you can issue a {@other-features/EX maneuvering order} as a bonus action.

subclassFeature.name: Thrill of the Hunt
entries: A successful hunt stokes your blood lust. When your Prey is reduced to 0 hit points you can use your reaction to mark another creature, and you gain one of the following benefits:

items: You gain temporary hit points equal to your Commander level.
You regain one expended use of Inspiring Word.
You regain one expended Exploit Die.

subclassFeature.name: Apex Predator
entries: Your primal bearing invigorates your pack mates. Your speed increases by 10 feet, and your weapon attacks against your Prey deal bonus damage equal to a roll of your Exploit Die.
Moreover, any creature you target with an Inspiring Word, Rallying Cry, or one of your Tactical Exploits also gains the benefits above until the beginning of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Academy of Schemes
entries: Commanders that join an Academy of Schemes are committed to securing victory at any cost. They have no qualms about how they achieve their goals and are willing to cheat, deceive, and sacrifice whatever they believe is necessary to succeed. Often distrustful of strangers, these utilitarians will always have a backup plan should things not work out as they predicted.

subclassFeature.name: Scheming Exploits
entries: You learn certain Exploits at the Commander levels noted in the table below. They don't count against your total number of Exploits Known and can't be switched upon gaining a level.

subclassFeature.name: Dastardly Talents
entries: You will use any method necessary to achieve your aims. You gain proficiency in Deception, Disguise Kits, and Poisoner's Kits. You can make Leadership Ability (Deception) checks in place of the normal Charisma (Deception) check.

subclassFeature.name: Cheap Shot
entries: You are not above dishonorable tricks to secure your victory. Once per turn when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can force it to make a Dexterity saving throw against your Exploit Save DC in addition to the damage of your attack.
On a failure, the creature's speed is halved and it can't take reactions until the start of your next turn, and on its next turn it can only take one action or one bonus action, but not both.

subclassFeature.name: Ruthless Focus
entries: You encourage allies to prey upon the weak. Any creature you target with an Inspiring Word or a Tactical Exploit can add your Leadership modifier to the first attack it makes against a creature suffering from the effects of Cheap Shot before the start of your next turn.
Also, whenever you use a Tactical Exploit as part of your action, you can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on that turn.

subclassFeature.name: Devious Tactics
entries: You have no qualms about leaving others in danger. When a creature you can see targets you with an attack, you can use your reaction to force another creature within 5 feet to make a Dexterity saving throw against your Exploit Save DC. On a failed save, you switch places with the creature and it becomes the target of the attack that triggered the reaction. A creature can willingly fail this saving throw.

subclassFeature.name: Inscrutable Mind
entries: Your thoughts and dreams cannot be read by magical means, unless you allow it. If a creature attempts to read your mind you can present false thoughts and motivations by making a Leadership Ability (Deception) check.

subclassFeature.name: Marked for Death
entries: You relentlessly pursue the destruction of your foes. When a creature fails its saving throw against Cheap Shot, you can choose to mark the creature for death. The first attack to hit that creature before the beginning of your next turn becomes an automatic critical hit.
Once you mark a creature for death you must complete a short or long rest before you can use this feature again.

subclassFeature.name: Academy of Tactics
entries: Commanders of this Academy most often come from the ranks of formal organizations that serve the elite. Tacticians are highly educated. They are known for their dedication to those they command, and their understanding of how to best utilize each of their allies' strengths and weaknesses.

subclassFeature.name: Advanced Tactics
entries: Your ability to learn and execute strategies in combat exceeds that of most leaders and even other trained Commanders. You gain the following benefits to your Commander features:

entries.name: Exploits
entries: You learn two {@other-features/EX attack-order?features-prereq-filter=—|Tactical Exploits} of your choice with no level prerequisite. These Exploits do not count against your total number of Exploits Known.

You learn additional Tactical Exploits following the same rules at certain levels: at 5th level you learn two {@other-features/EX crescendo-of-violence?features-prereq-filter=5|Exploit} with a level 5 prerequisite, and at 9th level you learn one {@other-features/EX daring-rescue?features-prereq-filter=9|Exploit} with a level 9 prerequisite.

entries.name: Exploit Dice
entries: Your total number of Exploit Dice increases by 1, and all of your Exploit Dice increase to become d6s.
At certain Commander levels your Exploit Dice increase again; at 5th level (d8), at 11th level (d10), and at 17th level (d12).

subclassFeature.name: The Art of War
entries: You have studied the great histories of warfare and combat. You gain proficiency in History and with two gaming sets of your choice. Whenever you make an ability check with any of these proficiencies you can double your proficiency bonus.

subclassFeature.name: Strategic Adjustments
entries: You are constantly adapting to meet any challenge. When you complete a long rest, you can replace one Tactical Exploit you currently know with a Tactical Exploit of your choice of the same degree.
When you reach 6th level in this class, you can do so whenever you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Brains over Brawn
entries: You wield your comrades as other warriors wield weapons. If you use a Tactical Exploit as your action, or use a Tactical Exploit in place of each attack you can make, you can use a bonus action on that turn to take the Disengage action, or to use one Order Exploit (such as attack order) that you know.

subclassFeature.name: Know Your Enemy
entries: You evaluate the potential of others at a glance. As an action, choose a creature you can see within 60 feet. You learn if it is your equal, superior, or inferior in one of the following areas:
Once you use this feature on a creature you cannot use it on that creature again until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Gifted Strategist
entries: You cannot be surprised while you are conscious, and when you roll initiative, you gain a special action that you can take at the start of combat before any other creature has a chance to act. This special action can only be used to use a Tactical Exploit you know or to take the Ready action.

subclassFeature.name: Master Tactician
entries: You have a plan in place for every eventuality. You learn the {@other-features/EX contingency plan} Exploit, but it doesn't count against your total number of Exploits Known. At the end of a long rest, you can use contingency plan without expending an Exploit Die to put the plan in place. You can only have a single contingency plan in place at any one time.

fluff.name: Savant
entries: These natural-born leaders stand as stalwart figures in the face of danger and can rally their allies to overcome whatever obstacles may stand between them and their goals.

tools: One set of {@item Artisian's Tools} of your choice

default: (a) a simple weapon of your choice or (b) a {@item shortsword}.
(a) A {@item light crossbow} and {@item crossbow bolt|20 bolts} or (b) two {@item dagger|daggers}.
a set of {@item artisan's tools}, {@item leather armor}, and {@item scholar's pack}.

tools: An Artisan's Tools of your choice

classFeature.name: Adroit Analysis
entries: You can focus your mind to analyze your foe. Beginning at 1st level, you can use a bonus action to analyze one creature you can see within 60 feet, designating it as your Focus. While it is your Focus, you gain the following benefits against it:

items: When you hit it with an attack, or if you observe it for 1 minute, you learn one of the following characteristics of your choice: its highest ability score, lowest ability score, Armor Class, speed, creature type, or one special sense.
You can use your Intelligence, instead of your Strength or Dexterity, for weapon attack and damage rolls against it.
Once per turn when you hit it with an attack, you deal {@dice 1d6} bonus damage. The bonus increases as you gain levels, to match the Intellect Die column of the Savant table above.
Any attacks it makes against you have disadvantage.

entries: It remains your Focus until you choose to end this effect (no action required), or it is hidden from you, if you designate another creature as your Focus, or if you are {@condition incapacitated}.
While you have a Focus, you cannot cast or concentrate on spells or use other features that require your {@status concentration}.

classFeature.name: Predictive Defense
entries: Your analytical style of fighting allows you to better anticipate and dodge attacks. Beginning at 1st level, when you calculate your Armor Class in light or medium armor, or when you are unarmored, you can use Intelligence in place of Dexterity.

classFeature.name: Scholarly Pursuits
entries: Never satisfied with your current state you are always looking to expand your educational horizons. At 1st level, you master one {@other-feathers/SP astrology|Scholarly Pursuit} from the list at the end of this class.
You master one additional Scholarly Pursuit of your choice when you reach 4th, 7th, 13th, and 18th level in this class.

classFeature.name: Genius Intellect
entries: Your mind is capable of wondrous bursts of insight, fortitude, and inspiration. At 2nd level, you gain the following benefits:

entries.name: Intellect Die
entries: These increased analytical abilities are represented by your Intellect Die, which begins as a d6. You start knowing three such features that make use of this Intellect Die: Calculated Flourish, Potent Observation, and Wondrous Insight.
At certain levels, your Intellect Die increases in size, as shown in the Intellect Die column on the Savant table.
If one of your Intellect Die features requires a creature to make a saving throw, the DC equals 8 plus your Intelligence modifier and {@rule Proficiency} Bonus.

classFeature.name: Calculated Flourish
entries: When a creature you can see targets you with a melee attack, you can use a reaction to add one roll of your Intellect Die to your Armor Class against that attack. If this Flourish causes the attack to miss, you can move up to 10 feet as part of the same reaction without provoking opportunity attacks.

classFeature.name: Potent Observation
entries: When another creature that can hear you hits the {@rule Focus} of your {@rule Adriot Analysis} with an attack, you can use your reaction to grant it a bonus to its damage roll equal to one roll of your Intellect Die.

classFeature.name: Wondrous Insight
entries: When another creature that can hear you makes an ability check using a skill or tool that you are proficient in, you can use your reaction to grant it a bonus to its roll equal to one roll of your Intellect Die. You can do so after it rolls the d20.

classFeature.name: Sharp Mind
entries: Your ability to analyze your surroundings is unrivaled. Also at 2nd level, you can use a bonus action on your turn to take the {@action Help} or {@action Search} actions, or make an Intelligence ability check to recall information about a creature or object you can see.
Moreover, you can use the {@action Help} action to aid a creature in attacking your {@rule Focus}, so long as you are within 5 feet of the attacker, even when you are not within 5 feet of the target.

classFeature.name: Academic Discipline
entries: Choose an Academic Discipline: Archaeologist, Investigator, Naturalist, Physician, or Tactician, each of which is detailed at the end of this class. Your Discipline grants you features at 3rd level, and again when you reach 6th, 10th, and 15th level.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Peerless Insights
entries: Your mind and its capabilities are truly wondrous. Beginning at 5th level, if another creature that can hear you is forced to make a saving throw, you can use your reaction to grant it a bonus to its roll equal to one roll of your Intellect Die.
Moreover, whenever you make an Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma saving throw you can add one roll of your Intellect Die to your saving throw, so long as you are not {@condition incapacitated}.

classFeature.name: Swift Reflexes
entries: The speed that you observe and react to your surroundings is incredible. Beginning at 5th level, you have a second reaction you can take each round, but only one reaction per trigger.
At certain Savant levels you gain additional reactions, you gain a third reaction at 13th level and a fourth at 18th level.

classFeature.name: Discipline Feature
entries: At 6th level, you gain a feature granted by your Academic Discipline.

classFeature.name: Keen Awareness
entries: You are always prepared for danger. Beginning at 7th level, so long as you aren't {@condition incapacitated} you cannot be surprised and you add your Intelligence modifier to your initiative rolls.
Also, when you roll initiative you can use {@rule Adriot Analysis} to designate a creature you can see within range as your Focus.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Predictive Expert
entries: You are seemingly always one step ahead of your chosen foes. Starting at 9th level, when your {@rule Focus} forces you to make an ability check or saving throw, you have advantage on your roll.

classFeature.name: Discipline Feature
entries: At 10th level, you gain a feature granted by your Academic Discipline.

classFeature.name: Unrivaled Genius
entries: Your intellect has risen to near-supernatural heights. At 11th level, your {@classFeature Genius Intellect|Savant|BREW|2} features gain the benefits below:

entries.name: Calculated Flourish
entries: If your reaction causes the attack to miss, you can make one melee attack against your attacker as part of your reaction.

entries.name: Potent Observation
entries: You can use this reaction whenever another creature that can hear you attacks a creature that you can see. Moreover, if you use this reaction when another creature attacks your Focus, you can add two rolls of your Intellect Die to its damage roll.

entries.name: Wondrous Insight
entries: When you use Wondrous Insight on another creature's ability check you roll your Intellect Die twice and use the higher roll.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Swift Reflexes (2)
entries: Beginning at 13th level, you have a third reaction you can take each round, but only one reaction per trigger.

classFeature.name: Unyielding Will
entries: At 14th level, you gain proficiency in Charisma saving throws, and you have advantage on any saving throw you are forced to make to resist the {@condition charmed} and {@condition frightened} conditions.

classFeature.name: Discipline Feature
entries: At 15th level, you gain a feature granted by your Academic Discipline.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Flawless Analysis
entries: Beginning at 17th level, you can use your action to flawlessly predict your {@rule Focus}'s next move and alert your allies. Until the start of your next turn, your Focus has disadvantage on every ability check, attack roll, and saving throw. Also, creatures of your choice that can hear you have advantage on any saving throw your Focus forces them to make until your next turn.
Once you use this feature you must finish a short or long rest before you can use it again.

classFeature.name: Swift Reflexes (3)
entries: Beginning at 18th level, you have a fourth reaction you can take each round, but only one reaction per trigger.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Incomparable Intellect
entries: At 20th level, you realize your true potential. Your Intelligence score increases by 4, up to a maximum of 24. Also, if you roll an Intellect Die and roll lower than your Intelligence modifier, you can replace the roll with your Intelligence modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Archaeologist
entries: Specializing in the study of forgotten civilizations, uncharted lands, and ancient places, Archaeologists bring the light of knowledge to the dark and deadly places of the world. Doing their best to uncover the wisdom of ages long past, they often tend to feel a sad kinship with the civilizations they study and go to great lengths not to destroy or offend their memory.

subclassFeature.name: Student of History
entries: You gain proficiency in {@skill History} and {@skill Investigation}. Whenever you make a check with either of these proficiencies you gain a bonus to your roll equal to one roll of your Intellect Die. If you are already proficient in either skill you gain proficiency in another skill from the Savant skill list in its place.
Also, if you spend 1 minute examining an object you are touching, you can ascertain its value, origin, and age. If it has magic properties, you learn them as if you had cast {@spell identify}.

subclassFeature.name: Adventuring Academic
entries: Your time in ancient places has given you insights into arcane items and honed your instincts. You gain the benefits below:

items: You gain a climbing speed equal to your walking speed.
When you make a saving throw related to a trap, you gain a bonus to your roll equal to one roll of your Intellect Die.
You ignore all class, race, and alignment requirements for attunement and use of magic items, scrolls, and potions. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for magic items.
You can cast and concentrate on spells from magic items, scrolls, and potions while you are using {@rule Adriot Analysis}.

activation.condition: When you make a saving throw related to a trap

subclassFeature.name: Daring Determination
entries: You are well acquainted with danger. Whenever you make a Dexterity saving throw, or an ability check related to a trap, you add one roll of your Intellect Die to the result of your roll.
Also, if you use your action to use a magic item, potion, or scroll you can make one weapon attack as a bonus action.

subclassFeature.name: Lore Master
entries: You constantly study every myth, legend, and folk tale you come across. If you observe a person, place, or object for at least 10 minutes, you mystically recall information about it as if it were the target of a {@spell legend lore} spell.
The target of this feature does not need to be of legendary importance in order for you to gain information. Though, if there is no relevant lore about the target you learn nothing.
Finally, when you use a magic item, you use your Intellect save DC for its effects unless the item's save DC was higher.

subclassFeature.name: Master Archaeologist
entries: Your familiarity with ancient magic has given you insight into its workings. You gain resistance to all damage from spells.
Also, when you finish a short rest, you can touch one magic item that normally regains its charges at dawn, and it regains expended charges equal to your Intelligence modifier.

foundrySystem.activation.condition: When you finish a short rest

subclassFeature.name: Investigator
entries: Excelling at unraveling mysteries, conspiracies, and secrets, Investigators possess an uncanny ability to read the intent of others. They often spend their lives working to thwart those who deceive the innocent and take advantage of the common trust. Their considerable minds and eye for the truth stand in the way of thieves, shapeshifters, and corrupt politicians.

subclassFeature.name: Student of Truth
entries: You gain proficiency in {@skill Insight} and {@skill Investigation}. Whenever you make a check with either of these proficiencies you gain a bonus to your roll equal to one roll of your Intellect Die. If you are already proficient in either skill you gain proficiency in another skill from the Savant skill list in its place.
Your intuitive nature grants you the following benefits:

items: Whenever you make an {@skill Insight} or {@skill Perception} check you can choose to use your Intelligence in place of Wisdom.
When you take the {@action Search} action, you gain information as if you spent a full minute searching instead of one action.

subclassFeature.name: Rough & Tumble
entries: You have gained some unsavory skills while fighting shadows in the underbelly of civilization. You learn to speak, read, and decode {@language Thieves' Cant}, the language of the criminal world.
Also, your unarmed strikes deal bludgeoning damage equal to a roll of your Intellect Die + your Strength modifier on hit.

When you hit your {@rule Focus} with a melee attack on your turn, you can force it to make a Dexterity saving throw against your Intellect save DC. On a failure, it is either {@condition blinded}, {@condition deafened}, or it cannot speak until the start of your next turn, or if the target is Large or smaller, you can choose to knock it {@condition prone}.

activation.condition: When you hit your Focus with a melee attack on your turn

subclassFeature.name: Devious Flourish
entries: Your intuition grants you a heightened sense for openings in your foe's defenses. When you use {@rule Calculated Flourish} and cause the attack to miss, you can force the attacker to make a Dexterity saving throw against {@rule Rough & Tumble} as part of the same reaction, instead of moving.
Also, whenever your {@rule Focus} fails the saving throw against Rough & Tumble, you can choose for it to take bludgeoning damage equal to one roll of your Intellect Die.
Finally, whenever you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn, you can make one unarmed strike attack as a bonus action.

subclassFeature.name: Illicit Contacts
entries: You have become familiar with the criminal elements of society. You have advantage on Charisma checks while you are communicating with another creature in {@language Thieves' Cant}.

You also master the {@other-features/SP Secrets & Whispers} Scholarly Pursuit, If you have already mastered this Scholarly Pursuit you can instead master your choice of {@other-features/SP Perfect Recall} or {@other-features/SP Traditions}.

subclassFeature.name: Piercing Gaze
entries: Your gaze sees through the most intricate deceptions and conspiracies. You instantly detect the presence of illusions and shapeshifters, and you are instantly aware if your {@rule Focus} is lying to you.
Also, if your Focus fails its saving throw against {@rule Rough & Tumble}, you can cause it to be {@condition stunned} for the duration in place of the normal effects.

subclassFeature.name: Master Investigator
entries: Your sense for truth has reached near-supernatural levels. You gain {@sense Truesight} out to a 30-foot radius.

Also, when you hit your {@rule Focus} with an attack, or use {@rule Potent Observation} against your Focus, you can cause the attack to become a critical hit. You can only do so once between each short or long rest.

activation.condition: When you hit your Focus with an attack, or use Potent Observation against your Focus

subclassFeature.name: Naturalist
entries: The Naturalist's classroom begins at the edges of civilization. They study the natural balance of ecosystems and will go to any lengths to maintain that balance. A true Naturalist is a protector of the wild and an expert at predicting the weather, identifying toxic and medicinal plants, and tracking animals.

subclassFeature.name: Student of Nature
entries: You gain proficiency in both {@skill Nature} and {@skill Survival}. Whenever you make a check with either of these proficiencies you gain a bonus to your roll equal to one roll of your Intellect Die. If you are already proficient in either skill you gain proficiency in another skill from the Savant skill list in its place.
Also, whenever you make an {@skill Animal Handling} or {@skill Survival} check you can use your Intelligence in place of Wisdom.

subclassFeature.name: Naturalist's Journal
entries: You compile your research on fantastical flora and fauna in a Naturalist's Journal. Over the course of 1 hour, which can be during a short or long rest, you can take notes in your Journal, detailing your current environment or a specific beast, plant, or monstrosity (such as a bear or {@creature griffon}) that was your {@rule Focus} within the last 24 hours. If your Journal is lost, you can spend 1 hour adding each old entry to a new Journal from memory.
You have advantage on all Intelligence checks related to all environments and creatures detailed in your Journal.
Finally, once per turn when you make an attack roll against a creature that is detailed in your Journal, you gain a bonus to your attack roll equal to one roll of your Intellect Die.

subclassFeature.name: Survivalist
entries: You are a master tracker of wild creatures and any that would threaten them. You can designate a creature as the Focus of your {@rule Adriot Analysis} by analyzing signs of its passing, such as tracks or marks, even if you can't see the creature. Creatures also remain your Focus even if they become hidden from you.

You also master the {@other-features/SP Physical Fitness} Scholarly Pursuit. If you have already mastered this Scholarly Pursuit, you instead master your choice of either {@other-features/SP Falconry} or {@other-features/SP Perfect Recall}.

subclassFeature.name: Wilderness Guide
entries: Your knowledge allows you and your companions to thrive in the wild places of the world. If you are in an environment that is detailed in your Journal, you and up to ten other creatures that travel with you gain the following benefits:

items: You can ignore the effects of nonmagical difficult terrain.
You cannot become lost, except by magical means.
You can move stealthily while traveling at a normal pace.

subclassFeature.name: Advanced Studies
entries: Your knowledge of the wild does not stop with the mundane. You can add specific dragons, giants, oozes, and undead to your {@subclassFeature Naturalist's Journal|Savant|BREW|Naturalist|BREW|3}. For example, you could add notes on a {@creature young blue dragon}, {@creature fire giant}, or {@creature ghast} to your Journal.
Your cutting-edge understanding of the natural world also grants your Naturalist's Journal the following extra benefits:

entries.name: Creatures
entries: You treat the specific creatures in your Journal as if they were your Focus, even if they are not currently designated as the Focus of your {@rule Adriot Analysis}.

entries.name: Environments
entries: You, and up to ten other creatures that are traveling with you can ignore the effects of magical difficult terrain and have advantage on their saving throws to resist the hostile effects of any of the environments you have detailed in your Journal.

subclassFeature.name: Call of the Wild
entries: As an action on your turn, you can force one beast, plant, or monstrosity within 30 feet to make a Wisdom saving throw against your Intellect save DC, so long as it can hear you. On a failure, it is {@condition charmed} by you for 1 hour. Creatures that have an Intelligence score equal to half your Savant level or higher automatically succeed on this saving throw.

While a creature is charmed, it is friendly to you and your allies. As a bonus action, you can issue a verbal command to the creature, which it does its best to obey on its next turn. Once it completes your command it defends itself to the best of its ability until you command it again with a bonus action.

If the creature takes damage, it repeats its Wisdom saving throw at the beginning of its next turn, ending this charm on a success. When it does so, you can use a reaction to shout at it and subtract one roll of your Intellect Die from its roll.

Once a creature succeeds on its saving throw against this feature it is immune to it for 24 hours. You can only have one creature charmed in this way, and charming another creature ends this effect for any other charmed creatures.
Once you successfully charm a creature you must complete a short or long rest before you can use this feature again.

subclassFeature.name: Master Naturalist
entries: Your knowledge of the natural world surpasses that of nearly all other scholars. You can add specific creatures of any type, except for constructs and humanoids, to your Journal. Also, the duration of {@rule Call of the Wild} increases to 8 hours, and creatures detailed in your Journal have disadvantage on their initial save to resist Call of the Wild.
Finally, you have advantage on attack rolls against any creatures detailed in your Journal.

subclassFeature.name: Physician
entries: Physicians use their considerable intellect to heal the sick and tend to the wounded.
